children.name: to shine with small bright points of light
sparkle x
children.definition: sparkle if sth such as a jewel, water, or icesparkles,it shines with many small, bright points of light, especially under the light:lấp lánh
examples: she wore a diamond necklace, which sparkled in the light of the fire.
dwayne’s eyes sparkled as he laughed.
when the sun came up, the snow sparkled as if it were studded with millions of diamonds.
sparkling[attri]b2
a pair of beautiful sparkling earrings.

children.name: twinkle x
children.definition: twinkle (of light or a shiny surface) to shine in the dark or under the light with small points of light: lấp lánh
examples: the lights of the town twinkled faintly in the distance.
over her shoulder, the stars twinkled in the black sky.
the lights of the town twinkled in the distance.
the stars twinkled in the clear sky.
his brown eyes twinkled behind the gold-rimmed glasses.

children.name: glisten x
children.definition: glisten to shine by reflecting light from a wet, oily or smooth surface : lóng lánh
examples: the grey roofs glistened after the rain.
glisten with
when we finished the set, katie’s face was red and glistening with sweat.
his eyes glistened with tears.

children.name: shimmer x
children.definition: shimmer especiallywrittento shine in such a way that the light seems to shake slightly and quickly:lung linh , lấp lánh, sóng sánh
examples: when he moved, his silk green shirt shimmered.
the lake shimmered in the moonlight.
she could see her reflection in the water, shimmering in the moonlight.

children.name: glitter x
children.definition: glitter if sth such as a jewel, a star, or iceglitters, it shines attractively, especially under the light, with very bright, small points of light: lấp lánh
examples: the frost glittered on the ground.
jewels glittered in the dim light of the cave.
the chandelier glittered, its crystal teardrops like small golden suns.
glittering[adj] shining with a lot of small bright flashes of light
the glittering skyline of manhattan

children.name: having a surface that doesn't shine
dull c1
children.definition: dull/dʌl/  a colour or surface that is dull is not bright or shiny:
examples: ▪ her hair was a dull, darkish brown.
▪ they chose a red clay pot decorated with patterns in dull white paint.
dulladjectivenot brighttối tăm; âm u; u ám; ảm đạm
not clear, bright or shiny; dark
_we could just see a dullglowgiven off by the fire's last embers.
_the first day of our holiday was dull (= cloudy) .

children.name: matt x
children.definition: mattalsomatteamerican /mæt/
examples: matt surface/paint/finish etca matt surface is designed not to be shiny - use this about paint, skin, surfaces etc that you do not want to be shiny:
▪ do you want matt paint or gloss paint?
▪ when you drop off the photos, be sure to request matte finish.
mattuk,usmatteadjective
describes a surface or colour or paint that is not shiny
_the paint is available in matt or gloss finish.

children.name: tarnished x
children.definition: tarnished/ˈtɑːʳnɪʃt/  no longer shiny - use this about brightmetalssuch as silver:
examples: ▪ he wore a tarnished watch chain across his waistcoat.
▪ you shouldn’t let the silverware get so tarnished.

children.name: shine b1
children.definition: shine if the sun, a lamp etcshines, it sends out bright light:chiếu sáng , tỏa sáng, tỏa nắng
examples: it wasn’t very warm, but at least the sun was shining.
she could see the lights of hong kong shining in the distance.
a light shone in a window of one of the houses.
shine in/on
could you move that lamp? it’s shining right in my eyes.
is that light shininginyour eyes?
shine brightly
the streetlights shone brightly and the sidewalks were filled with people.

children.name: glow c2
children.definition: glow to make a warm soft light that is not very bright:chiếu sáng , tỏa nắng, cháy hồng
examples: the evening sun glowed in the sky.
a few lumps of coal still glowed in the fire.
the windows were glowing with a warm, yellow light.

children.name: blaze x
children.definition: blaze to give off anextremelybright light:sáng rực , rực sáng,
examples: the midday sun blazed down on us.
the windows of the cathedral were blazing with coloured light.
lights blazed in every room in the house.
blazing[attri]
a line of camels moved across the dunes under a blazing sky.
blaze[cs]
blaze of
the rabbit stopped, caught in the blaze of the car’s headlights.

children.name: flash b2
children.definition: flash to shine brightly for a very short time :bừng sáng
examples: lightning flashed across the sky.
a police car sped through the intersection, lights flashing

children.name: flicker x
children.definition: flicker use this about a weak flame or light that keeps becoming almost dark, so that it seems to be soon going to stop shining:lập lòe (như sắp tắt)
examples: the candle flickered a few times and then went out.
the lights flickered; i wondered if we were about to lose our power.

children.name: blink x
children.definition: blink if a light on a machineblinks,it goes on and off, especially in order to make you notice sth:nhấp nháy
examples: when i got in, the message light on my answering machine was blinking.
the neon lights on the theater blinked red and blue.

children.name: shine x
children.definition: shine/ʃaɪn/
examples: sự bóng, láng
▪ they polished their boots to a dazzling shine.
▪ linseed oil helps restore the shine to a dull surface.
shinenoun[ s or u ]
when something is bright from reflected light on its surface
_hair with body and shine
_wax polish gives a lovely shine to wood furniture.

children.name: sheen x
children.definition: sheen/ʃiːn/  a soft, smooth, shiny appearance:
examples: ▪ her elegant dress had a silver sheen.sheen of
▪ a light sheen of perspiration covered his upper lip.
sheennoun[ s ]approving
a bright, smooth surface
_the conditioner gives the hair a beautiful soft sheen.

children.name: gloss x
children.definition: gloss/glɒsǁglɔːs, glɑːs/  the shiny appearance of something that is of good quality or in good condition:
examples: ▪ the gel is guaranteed to add gloss even to the dullest hair.
▪ stephanie did not look well. the gloss had gone from her blond hair and her skin was splotchy looking.
high gloss
avery shiny gloss
▪ the silverware had been polished to a high gloss.

children.name: lustre x
children.definition: lustrebritish /lusteramerican /ˈlʌstəʳ/  written a soft, attractive, shiny appearance:
examples: ▪ autumn had given the trees that extra golden lustre.
▪ the herb can be used as a hair rinse to add luster.
▪ wax is sprayed on the apples to give them more luster.
lustreuk,uslusternoun
[ s or u ] the brightness that a shiny surface has
_a treatment for restoring the lustre to dull hair
_the rich lustre of well-polished furniture

children.name: when sth shines in the dark
luminous x
children.definition: luminous sth that isluminousshines in the dark, especially because it is made from or painted with a substance that shines:phát quang
examples: it’s a good idea to paint your bike with luminous paint so that you are more visible to motorists.
he couldn’t tell what time it was since his watch didn’t have a luminous dial.

children.name: fluorescent x
children.definition: fluorescent made from a very brightly coloured material which throws back light from its surface very strongly, and can easily be seen:huỳnh quang
examples: if you plan to jog along roadsides, it’s a good idea to wear at least one article of fluorescent clothing.
i’m sorry, but fluorescent green socks are just not suitable for a job interview.

children.name: glow in the dark u
children.definition: glow in the dark sth that glows in the darkgives off a continuous soft light and can be easily seen when it is dark, especially because it is covered in special paint: phát sáng trong đêm
examples: one of the children was playing with a yo-yo which glowed in the dark.
outside the cathedral, vendors were selling small statues of the virgin which glowed in the dark.

children.name: shiny b1
children.definition: shiny/ˈʃaɪni/
examples: ▪ she wore a fashionable jacket and high shiny boots.
▪ at 7:30 p.m. sharp, a shiny limousine pulled in front of the building.
▪ to keep the surface shiny, apply a clear, high-gloss varnish.
shinyadjective sáng chói, bóng
a shiny surface is bright because it reflects light
_beautiful shiny hair
_shiny black shoes
_a shiny silver dollar

children.name: glossy x
children.definition: glossy/ˈglɒsiǁˈglɔːsi, ˈglɑːsi/ glossyhair or fur looks shiny and healthy;glossymagazines and books use expensive shiny paper:
examples: ▪ she stroked the horse’s long glossy neck.
▪ there was a stack of glossy magazines on the coffee table.
glossyadjective( tron bong )
smooth and shiny
_she has wonderfully glossy hair.
_a dog with a glossy coat
glossilyadverb

children.name: sleek x
children.definition: sleek /sliːk/  hair or fur that issleekis shiny and smooth, especially because it is in good condition:
examples: ▪ the cat purred as ben stroked its sleek fur.
▪ linda looked wonderful at the party; her hair was long and sleek, her make-up perfect.
sleekadjective
(especially of hair, clothes or shapes) smooth, shiny and lying close to the body, and therefore looking well cared for; not untidy and with no parts sticking out
_the cat had sleek fur.
_who owns that sleek black car parked outside your house?
_disapprovinghe's one of those sleek (= seeming rich and dishonest) businessman types.

children.name: silky x
children.definition: silky/ˈsɪlki/  hair, material etc that issilkyis soft and smooth to touch and looks shiny:
examples: ▪ you’re so lucky to have such lovely, silky hair.
▪ her skirt and jacket were made of smooth, silky fabric.
silkyadjectiveusually approving
soft and smooth, like silk
persian cats have long, silky fur.
figurativethe villain leans over and
speaks to her in a silky persuasive voice.

children.name: polished x
children.definition: polished/ˈpɒlɪʃtǁˈpɑː-/  something such as wood, metal, or stone that ispolishedhas been made shiny by being rubbed:
examples: ▪ her nails were beautifully shaped and polished.
▪ a polished oak floor
polishedadjectiveclean
having been polished
_a highly polished floor

children.name: gleaming x
children.definition: gleaming/ˈgliːmɪŋ/ gleamingobjects or vehicles are shiny because they are very new or clean:
examples: ▪ every surface in the kitchen was polished and gleaming.
▪ a gleaming harley davidson motorcycle stood parked outside the bar.

children.name: shimmering x
children.definition: shimmering/ˈʃɪmərɪŋ/  shining with a soft, unsteady light:
examples: ▪ they looked out across the shimmering water of the lagoon.
▪ gabby pulled a shimmering gold evening dress out of a box and held it in front of her.
shimmeringadjectivelờ mờ
reflecting a gentle light which seems to move slightly
_we drove across the desert, through the shimmering heat haze.

children.name: glistening x
children.definition: glistening /ˈglɪsənɪŋ/  shining like something that is wet:
examples: ▪ his glistening bald head moved from side to side in time to the music.
▪ the harpoon sank into the whale’s glistening skin.

children.name: when sth shines in the light
catch the light x
children.definition: catch the light if sth catches the light, a light shines on it and makes it look shiny. bắt ánh sáng

children.name: gleam x
children.definition: gleam to shine brightly, especially by throwing back light off a very smooth surface :sáng bóng
examples: a rolls royce was parked outside, gleaming in the sunshine.
the floors gleamed, and the house smelled sweetly of soap and fresh air.
the old walnut dining table gleamed under the chandelier.
gleam with
on his left was the galley, a tiny kitchen gleaming with stainless steel.
gleam[cs]
gleam of
i heard the back door of the house open, and saw the gleam of a lantern.
